summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the briefing schedule for Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail. The letter proposes dates for submissions and a hearing, requests sealed filings, and asks for an extension of the page limit for the motion.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, co-signer of the letter to the court proposing a bail motion briefing schedule.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, co-signer of the letter to the court proposing a bail motion briefing schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330), for whom the defense attorneys are filing a renewed motion for release on bail.

connections.description: Cohen is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case.
Everdell is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case.
Both are partners at Cohen & Gresser LLP and are co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Bail Motion Submission
events.description: Proposed date for the defense to submit its renewed motion for release on bail.

events.title: Government Response to Bail Motion
events.description: Proposed date for the government to file its response to Maxwell's bail motion.

events.title: Defense Reply Due
events.description: Proposed date for the defense to file its reply to the government's response.

events.title: Bail Motion Hearing
events.description: Proposed date for a hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
COHEN & GRESSER LLP, 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor, New York, New York 10022
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was actively pursuing a renewed motion for her release on bail in December 2020.
The proposed briefing schedule aimed to conclude with a hearing before the December 2020 holidays.
The defense requested to file a motion exceeding the standard page limit, up to 40 pages, due to the complexity of the bail application.
All submissions related to the bail motion were to be filed under seal initially, with proposed redacted versions for public docketing.
